meanings.definition: An unborn or unhatched offspring in the early stages of development.
meanings.sent1: The embryon of the bird was still inside the egg.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the embryon of various animals to understand development.
meanings.sent3: The embryon in the nest seemed to be playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like an embryon waiting to hatch into something great.
meanings.sent5: The tiny embryon was fragile but full of potential.

meanings.definition: A rudimentary or undeveloped form of something.
meanings.sent1: The sketch was just an embryon of the final masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: His plan was still in the embryon stage, needing more details.
meanings.sent3: The embryon of the story left the readers curious for more.
meanings.sent4: The small plant was like an embryon waiting to grow into a tree.
meanings.sent5: The embryon of the idea held promise for future success.
